claim: Flublok ensures identical antigenic match with WHO- and FDA-selected flu strains.

rejected_evidence.original_explanation: This identifies Flublok as the recombinant influenza vaccine (RIV4) being studied, which is relevant because the claim is about Flublok's antigenic match.

rejected_evidence.quote: because it is not subject to mutations to the A (H3 N2) glycosylation binding site that reduce the effectiveness of egg based vaccines.
rejected_evidence.original_explanation: This statement supports the claim by indicating that Flublok (RIV4) is not subject to egg-adapted mutations, which can cause antigenic mismatch in egg-based vaccines, thus implying that Flublok maintains an identical antigenic match to the selected strains.
